comments:
Hello,

i'm having problems using interfaces 
exported to equinox framework via a system.bundle fragment, 
imported and exported via a bundle B1
and trying to use those interfaces in bundle B2 where B1 is a required bundle of
B2.

i'm running equinox in a servlet-bridge like fashion in a web application.

osgi.parentClassloader=ext
osgi.contextClassLoaderParent=ext

i'm exporting packages of the web application to equinox via a system.bundle fragment:

snippet from system.bundle fragment MANIFEST:

Bundle-Name: System-Bundle-Export-Fragment
Bundle-SymbolicName: system.bundle.export.fragment
Bundle-Version: 0.1.1
Fragment-Host: system.bundle; extension:=framework
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Export-Package: org.osgi.service.useradmin,
 org.osgi.service.prefs,
 com.os.ui,
 com.os.ui.action,
 ...


---

this works!

a bundle com.os.ecm.osgi.ui_service is importing package 
com.os.ui and it uses interfaces in the package.
the bundle also exports package com.os.ui .

(the bundle itself does not have any classes for this package.
the bundle jar does not contain any additional libraries.
Thus, it should be sure there are no conflicts between the
package provided by the fragment and this bundle).

Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
Bundle-Name: Ui_service Plug-in
Bundle-SymbolicName: com.os.ecm.osgi.ui_service
Bundle-Version: 0.1.1
Bundle-Activator: com.os.ecm.osgi.ui.impl.Activator
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Import-Package: com.os.ui,
 com.os.ui.action,
 ...
 org.apache.commons.logging,
 org.osgi.framework;version="1.3.0"
Export-Package: com.os.ecm.osgi.ui,
 com.os.ecm.osgi.ui.action,
 com.os.ecm.osgi.ui.registry,
 com.os.ui,
 com.os.ui.action,
 ...

this works, too.
the classes of this bundle can use the interfaces in package com.os.ui .

Now comes the next bundle which would like to use stuff from com.os.ui
by declaring the former bundle com.os.ecm.osgi.ui_service is a required bundle:

MANIFEST:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
Bundle-Name: ECM Visualization Plug-in
Bundle-SymbolicName: com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization
Bundle-Version: 0.1.1
Bundle-Activator: com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization.impl.Activator
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Import-Package: com.os.ecm.environment,
 com.os.ecm.typesystem.type,
 com.os.ecm.typesystem.value,
 com.os.ecm.visualization,
 com.os.ecm.visualization.mask,
 com.os.ecm.visualization.mask.layout,
 com.os.ecm.visualization.type,
 com.os.util.logging,
 org.apache.commons.logging,
 org.osgi.framework;version="1.3.0"
Require-Bundle: com.os.ecm.osgi.ui_service
Export-Package: com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization
Bundle-Vendor: Optimal Systems GmbH
Bundle-ClassPath: .

According to the OSGi specification bundle com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization
should be able to import and use all packages exported by com.os.ecm.osgi.ui_service .

THIS DOES NOT WORK.

The packages com.os.ecm.osgi.ui_service imported from the system.bundle
are not imported by bundle com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization .
This results in a ClassNotFoundException.
 
console:

Am i missing something?

Workaround:

if bundle com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization imports the package com.os.ui explicity via Import-Package it works.

Hi Lutz,

A bundle cannot both import and export a package at least in terms of how it's treated when resolved. What happens is that the resolver will select the bundle as *either* an importer or an exporter but not both. There is a little bit more detail to be found a few paragraphs down in section 3.7 of the R4.1 OSGi Core spec.

You "can" re-export dependencies by using Require-Bundle (for example Require-Bundle: system.bundle) although I would tend to prefer explicitly adding an Import-Package in your other bundle. Another approach to consider is to modify your interfaces in com.os.ecm.osgi.* to use an internal wrapper for the exposed classes in com.os.ui.

traces.message: The activator com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization.impl.Activator for bundle com.os.ecm.osgi.visualization is invalid
